meanings.definition: To include or form into a corporation again.
meanings.sent1: After the merger, the company is reincorporating its subsidiaries.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors decided to start reincorporating the business units.
meanings.sent3: The CEO joked that he was reincorporating the office snacks into his diet plan.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was reincorporating pieces of her old self after the retreat.
meanings.sent5: The process of reincorporating the legal documents was tedious but necessary.

meanings.definition: To reintegrate or bring back into a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The team is reincorporating the members who were on leave.
meanings.sent2: The school is slowly reincorporating the students after the break.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy was happily reincorporating into the family.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were reincorporating into the project, adding new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: Reincorporating the missing puzzle piece completed the picture perfectly.
